1{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Specialize generic relmaps to specialized relmaps
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relmap.Specialize
7  ( relmapSpecialize, 
8    RelmapLinkTable',
9  ) where
10
11import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                 as B
12import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax               as S
13import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data                 as D
14import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Lexmap          as C
15import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relkit          as C
16import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relmap.Relmap   as C
17import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Lexmap.Message  as Msg
18import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core.Relmap.Message  as Msg
19
20-- | Table for referencing relmap of 'C.RelmapLink'.
21type RelmapLinkTable' h c = [(C.Lexmap, C.Relmap' h c)]
22
23-- | Specializes generic relmap to specialized relmap,
24--   i.e., 'C.Relmap' to 'C.Relkit'.
25--   Specialized relmaps have fixed input/output headings.
26--   In constrast, generic relmaps do not.
27--   Specialized relmaps are also called relkits.
28--   This function returns relkit and extended table of relkits.
29relmapSpecialize :: forall h. forall c.
30    h c -> RelmapLinkTable' h c -> C.RelkitTable c
31    -> Maybe D.Head -> C.Relmap' h c -> B.Ab (C.RelkitTable c, C.Relkit c)
32relmapSpecialize hook links = spec [] [] where
33    spec :: [((S.Token, S.Local String), D.Head)]  -- name of local relation, and its heading
34         -> [C.RelkitKey]        -- information for detecting cyclic relmap
35         -> C.RelkitTable c      -- list of known specialized relkits
36         -> Maybe D.Head         -- input head feeding into generic relmap
37         -> C.Relmap' h c        -- generic relmap to specialize
38         -> B.Ab (C.RelkitTable c, C.Relkit c)
39    spec local keys kdef he1 rmap = s where
40        s = case rmap of
41              C.RelmapSource lx p ns -> post lx $ Right (kdef, C.relkitSource p ns)
42              C.RelmapConst  lx rel  -> post lx $ Right (kdef, C.relkitConst rel)
43
44              C.RelmapAppend rmap1 rmap2 ->
45                  do (kdef2, kit2) <- spec local keys kdef he1 rmap1
46                     (kdef3, kit3) <- spec local keys kdef2 (C.relkitOutput kit2) rmap2
47                     Right (kdef3, kit2 B.<> kit3)
48
49              C.RelmapCalc lx makeKit rmaps ->
50                  post lx $ do
51                     (kdef2, kits) <- list kdef rmaps
52                     kit <- makeKit kits he1
53                     Right (kdef2, kit)
54
55              C.RelmapHook lx makeKit ->
56                  post lx $ do
57                     kit <- makeKit hook he1
58                     Right (kdef, kit)
59
60              C.RelmapCopy lx n rmap1 ->
61                  do let p      = C.lexToken lx
62                         heJust = B.fromJust he1
63                         local' = ((p, S.LocalSymbol n), heJust) : local
64                     (kdef2, kit2) <- post lx $ spec local' keys kdef he1 rmap1
65                     Right (kdef2, C.relkitCopy p n kit2)
66
67              C.RelmapNest lx rmap1 ->
68                  do let heJust    = B.fromJust he1
69                         heNest    = D.headNested heJust
70                         vars      = map fst heNest
71                         p         = C.lexToken lx
72                         tk (n,he) = ((p, S.LocalNest n), he)
73                         heInd     = vars `B.snipIndex` D.getTermNames heJust
74                         local'     = map tk heNest ++ local
75                         nestInd   = zip vars heInd
76                     (kdef2, kit2) <- post lx $ spec local' keys kdef he1 rmap1
77                     Right (kdef2, C.relkitNest p nestInd kit2)
78
79              C.RelmapLink lx
80                  | C.lexType lx == C.LexmapLocal ->
81                      post lx $ case find tok of
82                           Just (p,he)  -> Right (kdef, C.relkitNestVar p n he)
83                           Nothing      -> Msg.unkNestVar n ps local
84                  | otherwise ->
85                      post lx $ case lookup lx links of
86                           Just rmap1 -> link n rmap1 (he1, C.relmapLexmaps rmap1)
87                           Nothing    -> Msg.unkRelmap n
88                  where
89                    tok = C.lexToken  lx
90                    n   = C.lexName   lx
91                    ps  = S.tokenParents tok
92
93        post :: C.Lexmap -> B.Map (B.Ab (C.RelkitTable c, C.Relkit c))
94        post lx result =
95            Msg.abSpecialize [lx] $ do
96               (kdef2, kit) <- result
97               Right (kdef2, C.relkitSetSource lx kit)
98
99        find (S.TLocal cp v eid (p:ps)) =
100            case lookup ((p,v)) local of
101              Just he -> Just (p,he)
102              Nothing -> find (S.TLocal cp v eid ps)
103        find _ = Nothing
104
105        -- specialize subrelmaps to subrelkits
106        list :: C.RelkitTable c -> [C.Relmap' h c] -> B.Ab (C.RelkitTable c, [C.Relkit c])
107        list kdef1 [] = Right (kdef1, [])
108        list kdef1 (rmap1 : rmaps) =
109            do (kdef2, kit)  <- spec local keys kdef1 he1 rmap1
110               (kdef3, kits) <- list kdef2 rmaps
111               Right (kdef3, kit : kits)
112
113        link :: String -> C.Relmap' h c -> C.RelkitKey -> B.Ab (C.RelkitTable c, C.Relkit c)
114        link n rmap1 key1
115            | key1 `elem` keys = Right (kdef, cyclic)
116            | otherwise = case lookup key1 kdef of
117                Just kit -> Right (kdef, kit)
118                Nothing  -> do (kdef2, kit1) <- spec local (key1 : keys) kdef he1 rmap1
119                               let kdef3 = (key1, kit1) : kdef2
120                               Right (kdef3, acyclic kit1)
121            where
122              cyclic        = C.Relkit Nothing Nothing body
123              acyclic kit1  = C.Relkit Nothing (C.relkitOutput kit1) body
124              body          = B.Sourced [] $ C.RelkitLink n key1 Nothing
125
